instructions: Tap and hold an app, shortcut, or folder. Slide it to the right until you see a blank Home screen, then release it. To remove a home screen, move all of your apps, shortcuts, widgets, and folders on to another one. After you've removed everything, the Home screen will disappear.

Tap and hold your finger on your phone's Home screen. A menu will pop up; tap Wallpapers . Pick a wallpaper from the options. To use an image you own, tap My photos . After you've chosen the one you want, tap Set wallpaper . You can then choose where to put it; tap Home screen or Home screen and lock screen .
Swipe up from the bottom of your screen and you should see all your apps. Tap and drag an app. You'll see images of each Home screen. Slide the app to where you want it.
Tap and hold the app, then release it. If the app has shortcuts, you'll see a list. Tap and hold the shortcut. Slide the shortcut to where you want it and release it.

Tap and hold on the Home screen. A menu will pop up; tap Widgets . Touch and hold a widget. You'll see images of your Home screens. Tap a widget, move it to where you want it, then release it. You can also resize some widgets. Touch and hold the widget on your Home screen and release it. You'll see an outline with dots on the sides. If you don't see an outline, you can't resize the widget. Drag the dots to resize the widget. Tap outside the widget to finish.

Touch and hold an app or shortcut. Drag the app or shortcut on top of another and release it. To add more, drag each one on top of the group. To name the group, tap the group, tap Unnamed Folder , then type a name.

Touch and drag the item. You'll see images of your Home screens. Slide the item to where you want it and release it. It's also easy to remove objects from the home screen. Tap and hold the one you want to delete. Drag the item up to the word Remove and release it.
